title: 109_s2342
content: The "Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006" establishes a Medicare-guaranteed prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The "Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006" introduces a Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Plan that offers coverage nationwide and involves negotiations with pharmaceutical manufacturers to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals. The Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006 establishes a plan for affordable drug coverage nationwide, with negotiated prices to reduce costs for eligible individuals. The plan includes strategies to lower the purchase cost of covered drugs and defines a Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Plan as offering standard coverage with access to negotiated prices. The monthly beneficiary premium for this plan is uniform nationally. The Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006 establishes a plan for affordable drug coverage nationwide, with negotiated prices to reduce costs for eligible individuals. The plan includes strategies to lower the purchase cost of covered drugs and defines a Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Plan as offering standard coverage with access to negotiated prices. The monthly beneficiary premium for this plan is uniform nationally and shall be equal to the base beneficiary premium applicable for the year. Sunset provisions for unnecessary plan requirements and fallback plans are also outlined, with limitations on their applicability after 2006. The Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006 establishes a plan for affordable drug coverage nationwide, with negotiated prices to reduce costs for eligible individuals. Amendments include the discontinuation of limited risk plans after 2006 and changes to the annual report requirements. Amendments to the Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006 include changes to beneficiary premiums and payments from the Medicare prescription drug account. Amendments to the Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Act of 2006 include changes to beneficiary premiums and payments for expenses incurred with respect to the operation of Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Plans. The amendments also provide definitions for terms related to Medicare-Guaranteed Prescription Drug Plans. These changes will take effect on the date of enactment of the Act. Improvement of Part D standard prescription drug coverage. The text discusses amendments to the deductible and coinsurance provisions of the Social Security Act related to Part D standard prescription drug coverage. The deductible is aligned with the amount applicable under section 1833(b), and the coinsurance is adjusted annually under section 1860D-2(b)(4)(B). Amendments are made to reduce coinsurance percentages in the Social Security Act related to Part D standard prescription drug coverage. The coverage gap is eliminated by repealing a specific paragraph. Amendments to the Social Security Act reduce coinsurance percentages for Part D prescription drug coverage and eliminate the coverage gap by repealing a specific paragraph. Additional revisions are made to benefit structures and supplemental prescription drug coverage. Amendments to the Social Security Act modify Part D prescription drug coverage by adjusting coverage limits and catastrophic coverage provisions. Additionally, changes are made to alternative prescription drug coverage options. The amendments include eliminating cost-sharing above the annual out-of-pocket threshold specified in subparagraph (B) of Section 1860D-2(b)(4)(A) of the Act. Amendments to the Social Security Act eliminate cost-sharing above the annual out-of-pocket threshold specified in subparagraph (B) and make conforming amendments to section 1860D-14(a). Effective date for these changes is January 1, 2007.
